question.body: What is the color of blood when it is flowing through the systemic veins?

response.feedback: Incorrect. Although veins may appear blue it is a trick of the light, the blood is not blue.
Correct. Venous blood appears darker red because it does not have as much oxygen.
Incorrect. Arterial blood is bright red because of the high levels of oxygen bound to the heme groups.
Incorrect. Venous blood is not purple although a trick of the light can cause the veins in our body to appear blue or purple.
